definition: see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to escape/to run away/to flee

sentences.english: The soldiers were punished for their base conduct in running away from the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 那些士兵由於臨陣脫逃的可恥行爲受到懲罰。

sentences.english: Freddy chickened out of the plan at the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 弗雷迪臨陣脫逃，最終退出了這個計劃。

sentences.english: He let the opportunity slip and fled the field.
sentences.chinese: 他錯過了機會，而且臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: He was accused of running away when the enemy attacked.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控在敵人進攻時臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: Put him in a designed crisis to see if he will escape or change his mind.
sentences.chinese: 設計一個危機的狀況，看他會不會臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: Henry wanted to ask Sue on a date, but then he chickened out.
sentences.chinese: 亨利想約蘇出去，但是他後來卻臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: Several white-livered fellows ran away at the beginning of the battle.
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥一開始，幾個膽小鬼就臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: What do you wish?Tobe known as a shirk.
sentences.chinese: 你希望成爲怎樣的人？是被認爲臨陣脫逃者。

definition: fight to the death/desperate struggle
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
unstable/erratic/changeable/fickle
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
switchboard operator
to disobey
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to force someone to do something
red in the face/extremely angry
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
